text: yeah so from the outside it you know the
first company link ex change that I
co-founded seemed like a success uh it
was actually a pretty sad thing selling
the company uh most people actually
don't know the reason why we ended up
selling the company it's because the
company culture just went completely
downhill I remember when it was just 5
or 10 of us it was kind of like your
typical docon back in the day this was
1996 and we were working around the
clock sleeping under a dust had no idea
what day of the week it was but it was a
lot of fun and but we didn't know any
better to pay attention to company
culture so by the time we got to 100
people we hired all the people with the
right skill sets and experiences but not
all of them were culture fits and yeah
when we when we got to 100 people I
remember I myself dreaded getting out of
bed in the morning to go to the office
and that was kind of a weird feeling cuz
this was a company I co-founded and if I
felt that way I wondered how all the
other employees must have felt so we
ended up selling the company and with
sapos wanted to make sure that I didn't
make the same mistake again so from the
beginning culture's always been really
important and you know to this day
culture is actually the number one
priority in the company and our whole
belief is that if we get the culture
right then most of the other stuff like
delivering great service or building a
long-term enduring brand will just
happen naturally on its
own uh so I guess my definition of you
know what culture would whether a
culture would be a right fit for me
personally would just be you would I
want to hang out with these people if we
weren't forced to work together and at
link exchange the answer was no and at
zapus the answer is yes yes in fact most
employees when they leave the office
leave to go hang out with others zis
employees and we spend our weekends
together and so that was
really that's probably the criteria I
use for whether a culture is right for
me well our whole belief is that if you
get the culture right then most of the
other stuff will happen naturally out of
it but it really depends on uh you know
what the culture is so that it's a big
if for us we've kind of formalized the
definition of our culture into our 10
core value so if you do a Google search
for Sapp's core values you'll see what
those 10 are and I guess inherent in
those 10 needs to be stuff that is
relevant to business for example uh one
of our core values is to embrace and
drive change I think that's really
important for business uh another one is
about being adventurous creative and
open-minded and uh another one is do
more with less and so I I definitely
think that the core values need to
incorporate business Concepts uh but
they don't necessarily need to
sound uh business C for example other
companies might say increase company
efficiencies which is is exactly what do
more with less means we we're just less
formal about it in terms of the actual
wording
